page.title: 01Summary,Wick
page.content: Our area covers only a very small part of the town of Wick,which has a population of 7000.The landward area has a considerable amount of grazing land with the ruins of many old crofts.Many are being replaced with modern bungalows.Part of the area is peat covered and this provides fuel for local people. Newton Burn makes its way to Wick River and alongside runs the old track of the Lybster to Wick railway.We have many old war ruins in our area.From the top of Newton Hill we have one of the best views including the gas station,the creamery,the hydro electric station,the primary school,the secondary school and the radio station.
